result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Katorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAY restitution in the amount of $28,950.00 payable to the victim, Arleen K. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
**06-07-2017/Amended Restitution Order - Court was informed that the victim of this case has been paid $27,800 towards restitution directly by the victim and through insurance. The victim states that the amount of restitution due and owing is $1,150., and therefore, the court will amend the total amount of restitution in this case to $1,150.

PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program or any other programming to assist defendant with making better decisions.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Straight time - STAYED until 06-26-2015 at 12:00 PM.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME CREDIT" for the condition time.

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error, restitution order date now reflects correct order date of 06-07-2017 not 07-07-2017 on JOC.
Per order signed 06-07-17 Rest. amended to 1,150.00.

BRANCH 7 FOR BRANCH 18
Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Amended restitution order. The court will amend the total amount of restitution in this case to $1,150.00.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. mag
Letter from victim with attachments indicating that restitution was paid directly by the victim and through insurance and that the balance of unpaid restitution is $1,150.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Colon

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[ X ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Lisa K.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS. 
Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, if deemed appropriate by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, if deemed appropriate by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 8 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction as straight time - STAYED until 06-26-2015 at 12:00 PM.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME CREDIT" for the condition time.
* No contact with the victims.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program or any other programming to assist defendant with making better decisions.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $28,950.00 payable to the victim, Arleen K. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing Referral Form.
with attached Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Joanne Hardtke on behalf of the State.

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
BRANCH 15 for BRANCH 02:
  Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/19/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 02.

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Timothy J. Cotter for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-28-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
FILED, INFORMATION DOCUMENT SIGNED 2-18-15

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Ron Dague for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Arleen K. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney James D. Jeffries.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb

Defendant Danielle M Katorski not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Da's office called us later in the afternoon on 2-6-2015 informing us that Ms. Kantorski was sitting in Rm. 110 all afternoon. She is ordered back in on Monday 2-9-2015, at 1:30 pm.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Danielle M Katorski not in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/6/15 @ 1:30pm
